article_text: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - An unborn baby girl suffering from a deadly inherited disease was treated successfully when doctors gave medicine to her mother. University of California doctors reported 'Thursday. 'Treating the baby by treating the mother is an "important new concept," tried only twice before, siud Dr. Seymour Packman of UC-San Francisco. 'The technique “could be applicable and very beneficial for a fair number of inherited metabolic diseases," he added. 'The child, Nicole Whitmore, of Santa Rosa, was bom last Dec. 21 with a disorder that prevents her body from utilizing a crucial vitamin called biotin. 'They diagnosed her problem 16 weeks into Debra Whitmore’s pregnancy — a diagnosis never before made on an unborn child, the university said. 'They looked for the disorder because Nicole’s older brother also inherited it.
